trans-unit.source: After the records for your domain name have propagated, you must associate them with your Web App.
trans-unit.target: After the records for your domain name have propagated, you must associate them with your Web App.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to enable the domain names using your web browser.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to enable the domain names using your web browser.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It can take some time for CNAME records created in the previous steps to propagate through the DNS system.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It can take some time for CNAME records created in the previous steps to propagate through the DNS system.

trans-unit.source: You cannot add the domain name of to your web app until the CNAME has propagated.
trans-unit.target: You cannot add the domain name of to your web app until the CNAME has propagated.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an A record, you cannot add the A record domain name to your web app until the **awverify** CNAME record created in the previous step has propagated.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an A record, you cannot add the A record domain name to your web app until the **awverify** CNAME record created in the previous step has propagated.

trans-unit.source: You can use a service such as http://www.digwebinterface.com/ to verify that the CNAME is available.
trans-unit.target: You can use a service such as http://www.digwebinterface.com/ to verify that the CNAME is available.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the [Azure Management Portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the [Azure Management Portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: In the **Web Apps** tab, click the name of your web app, select **Settings**, and then select **Custom domains and SSL**
trans-unit.target: In the **Web Apps** tab, click the name of your web app, select **Settings**, and then select **Custom domains and SSL**

trans-unit.source: In the **Custom domains and SSL** blade, click **Bring external domains**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Custom domains and SSL** blade, click **Bring external domains**.

trans-unit.source: Use the **DOMAIN NAMES** text boxes to enter the domain names to associate with this web app.
trans-unit.target: Use the **DOMAIN NAMES** text boxes to enter the domain names to associate with this web app.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save the domain name configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save the domain name configuration.

trans-unit.source: Once configuration has completed, the custom domain name will be listed in the **domain names** section of your web app.
trans-unit.target: Once configuration has completed, the custom domain name will be listed in the **domain names** section of your web app.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you should be able to enter the custom domain name in your browser and see that it successfully takes you to your web app.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you should be able to enter the custom domain name in your browser and see that it successfully takes you to your web app.
